intro: Isoetes tenella f. lativelata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf watermilfoil, is a rare aquatic plant belonging to the family Isoetaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, ribbon-like leaves that are typically submerged in freshwater environments. This fern-like plant forms dense underwater stands, often in still or slow-moving waters. It plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and oxygen for various aquatic organisms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive indicator of water quality.
